container.heading: Nontidal Wetlands of Special State Concern

section.heading: Areas Designated as Nontidal Wetlands of Special State Concern.
section.text: Maps of areas designated as nontidal wetlands of special State concern shall be maintained by the Department and available for public review. Areas designated as nontidal wetlands of special State concern are listed below:

para.text: Fort George G. Meade Laurel, Odenton
John Wesley Church Site Round Bay
Mountain Road Peninsula Bog Complex Round Bay, Gibson Island
Big Gunpowder Falls—Forge Road Site White Marsh
Putty Hill Wetlands Towson, White Marsh
Battle Creek Cypress Swamp Broomes Island, Prince Frederick
Calvert Cliffs State Park Cove Point
West Governor Run Watershed Prince Frederick
Charlestown West Seeps Havre De Grace
Log Cabin Sedge Meadow Conowingo Dam
Whitaker Swamp North East, Havre De Grace, Bay View
Thomas Stone National Historic Site Port Tobacco
Zekiah Swamp Brandywine, Hughesville, La Plata, Popes Creek, Charlotte Hall
Big Millpond East New Market, Rhodesdale
Cabin Creek Seep East New Market, Preston
Dorchester Pond East New Market, Rhodesdale
Catoctin Creek Mouth Point of Rocks
Hunting Creek Hollow Blue Ridge Summit
Little Fishing Creek Pond Catoctin Furnace
Owens Creek Swamp Blue Ridge Summit
South Salamander Rock Fire Ponds Catoctin Furnace
Upper Hunting Creek Swamp Blue Ridge Summit
North Laurel Run Swamp Table Rock, Davis
The Little Mountain North Woods Gorman
Upper Salt Block Run Sang Run
West Deer Park Meadow Deer Park
Southwest Branch Bottomland Forest Lanham, Upper Marlboro
Dublin Swamp Princess Anne, Dividing Creek
Mill Creek Wildlife Sanctuary Wye Mills
Oak Hill Road Powerline Dividing Creek
Porter Neck Bog Berlin, Ninepin Branch
West Ocean City Pond Ocean City

section.heading: Areas Designated as Nontidal Wetlands of Special State Concern Located in the Critical Area.

para.text: Maps of areas designated as nontidal wetlands of special State concern in the Critical Area shall be maintained by the Department and available for public review. Areas designated as nontidal wetlands of special State concern in the Critical Area are listed in §§B—Q of this regulation.
Cypress Creek Swamp Natural Heritage Area Round Bay
Mountain Road Peninsula Bog Complex Round Bay, Gibson Island
Upper Patuxent Marshes Natural Heritage Area Bristol
Baltimore County—Black Marsh Natural Heritage Area Sparrows Point
Cove Point Marsh Natural Heritage Area Cove Point
Flag Ponds Natural Heritage Area Cove Point
Randle Cliff Beach Natural Heritage Area North Beach
Battle Creek Cypress Swamp Broomes Island
Great and Little Bohemia Creeks Cecilton
Grove Neck Natural Heritage Area Spesutie, Earleville, Galena
Plum Creek Natural Heritage Area Elkton, North East
Mattawoman Creek Indian Head, Port Tobacco
Allens Fresh Natural Heritage Area Popes Creek
Chicamuxen Creek Natural Heritage Area Indian Head
Popes Creek Natural Heritage Area Popes Creek
Upper Nanjemoy Creek Natural Heritage Area Nanjemoy
Chicone Creek Natural Heritage Area Mardela Springs, Rhodesdale
Mill Creek Natural Heritage Area Mardela Springs
Savanna Lake Natural Heritage Area Chicamacomico River, Nanticoke
Upper Blackwater River Natural Heritage Area Golden Hill
Upper Nanticoke River, Marshes, and Swamps Natural Heritage Area Rhodesdale, Sharptown
Robinson Neck Golden Hill, Taylors Hill
South Lapidum Aberdeen, Havre de Grace
Gasheys Run Aberdeen, Havre de Grace
Northern Susquehanna Aberdeen, Conowingo Dam Canal
Upper Patuxent Marshes Natural Heritage Area Bristol
Queen Anne's County—Tuckahoe Creek North Ridgely
Carroll's Pond Peat Bog Point No Point
Hickory Point Cypress Swamp Natural Heritage Area Kingston, Snow Hill
Upper Nanticoke River, Marshes, and Swamps Natural Heritage Area Sharptown
Hickory Point Cypress Swamp Kingston, Snow Hill
Lower Nassawango Creek Natural Heritage Area Snow Hill
Mattaponi Natural Heritage Area Snow Hill, Girdletree, Pocomoke City

section.heading: Best Management Practices for Nontidal Wetlands of Special State Concern and Expanded Buffers.
section.text: If a permit or other authorization is granted, the Department may require an applicant to comply with best management practices, including one or more of the following:

para.text: Protect against future disturbances to the nontidal wetland of special State concern by showing its surveyed boundary, expanded buffer, waterways, and 100-year floodplains on the property deed, and recording the information with the county;

Avoid impacts to regulated wetlands, buffers, expanded buffers, waterways, 100-year floodplains, and steep slopes or highly erodible soils as described in COMAR 26.23.01.04C that may cause an adverse impact to the nontidal wetland of special State concern;
Restrict regulated activities to the minimum area necessary to meet the project purpose;
Maintain existing groundwater recharge to the nontidal wetland of special State concern and tributaries to nontidal wetlands of special State concern by limiting impervious surfaces;

Use nonstructural stormwater management practices consistent with those in COMAR 26.17.02, to the extent practicable, such as infiltration, retention of forest, wetlands, and associated buffers, undisturbed floodplains, open space, and steep slopes, in association with structural stormwater management on properties with nontidal wetlands of special State concern or tributaries to nontidal wetlands of special State concern;
Manage runoff so that there is no direct discharge of stormwater into wetlands or waterways;
Restrict impervious surface on the project site to 15 percent or less, where practicable;
Install sediment controls such as super silt fences or comparable controls to completely surround all disturbed areas and maintain controls daily;
Stabilize disturbed areas daily with noninvasive native species;

Place vegetative waste, including yard waste, grass clippings, leaves, etc. or other debris outside of regulated wetlands, expanded buffers, waterways, and 100-year floodplains that are in the drainage area of the nontidal wetland of special State concern; or
Use other management practices listed in COMAR 26.23.03.02.

annotations.annotation: Environment Article, §§5-901—5-911, Annotated Code of Maryland
Chapter revised as an emergency provision effective January 1, 1991 (18:2 Md. R. 128)
Chapter revised effective May 13, 1991 (18:9 Md. R. 1007)
Regulations .01—.04, .08, .09, .14, .15, and .22 amended and Regulation .27 adopted as an emergency provision effective October 1, 1993 (20:21 Md. R. 1649); emergency status expired April 1, 1994

Regulations .01—.04, .08, .09, .14, .15, and .22 amended and Regulation .27 adopted as an emergency provision effective June 1, 1994 (21:13 Md. R. 1151); Regulations .01—.04, .08, .09, .14, and .22 amended and .27 adopted permanently effective October 24, 1994, (21:21 Md. R. 1813)
Regulations .01 and .15—.18 amended and Regulation .17-1 adopted effective November 7, 1994 (21:22 Md. R. 1874)
Regulations .01 and .02 were recodified from Regulations .26 and .27, respectively, under COMAR 08.05.04 Nontidal Wetlands, June 1996
